newsitem.title: UK: World Insurance Network chief executive resigns.
newsitem.headline: World Insurance Network chief executive resigns.

text.p: The chief executive of World Insurance Network (WIN), a company planning to launch electronic commerce services for the global insurance industry, has decided to step down.
Michael Heath has decided to leave for personal reasons, WIN chairman Dennis Mahoney said in a statement.
WIN is owned by six of the world's largest insurance brokers -- Alexander & Alexander, Aon Group, Johnson & Higgins, Marsh & McLennan, Sedgwick and Willis Corroon.
"The six founding brokers continue to be totally committed to the success of WIN, and are pleased with the progress made to date," said Mahoney.
Richard Wales will handle day-to-day management in the meantime until WIN finds a long term replacement for Heath.
